td.p: McKenzie, Alexander. Journal of Great Bear Lake, 1805-1806. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0006

div.p: I left Arthebaska Sunday 15th Septr 1805[.] [A]t 5 O Clock in the evening the 12th I sent of 3 Loaded Cannoes 4 men each 18 trading pieces of Goods in each Cannoe Mr Ruth & Mr Grant and in my own Cannoe 5 men Mr Henry & myself with 7 trading pieces which in all formed 61 trading pieces of Goods for McKenzies River of which I was to take charge of[.] [T]here was such a Large swell that it was nessesary to put on shore after having Shiped three or four Gallons of watter 3 miles from the fort and Encamp for the night[.]
[I]t was 6 O Clock this morning before we was able to load the Cannoe and had a severe head wind all day[.] [A]t 7 O Clock in the evening encamped on a Island 3 miles below the Landsorn hill[.]
Embarked at 1 O Clock in the morning passed all the portages and encamped at Gravel point 7 O Clock in the evening[.]

Embarked at 2 O Clock in the morning[.] [P]ut a shore at salt River to take my Tea kettle that I had hiden there on my way to Arthebaska being out of tea & Sugar – which has been a great saving to me since I left Arthabaska as I have not made use of Tea or sugar since my departure from there[.] [A]t two O Clock I put a shore on a Island where there was three Lodges of Chipewayans[.] I reced 10 Skins in meet from them for which I gave them a note to Mr D. McK. I informed them of the Hudsons Bay Gentlemens leaving the Countrie in the Spring &ca &ca &ca[.] Encamped at 6 O Clock 6 miles below the detour[.]

Embarked at 12 O Clock of the night[.] [A]t 12 O Clock stoped at the little Lake to Know the reason why no men was with the Indians a long the River[.] I embarked after having spent a ¼ of a hour to prosed to slave Lake to be ready to make the Treverse in the morning[.] [A]t the enterence of the Little Channel I found my 3 Cannoes[.] [T]hey was a drying a Bale that had got wet by axcident[.] I requested of them to follow as soon as the Goods was in order and camp with me at moosedeer Island[.] Encamped at Moosedeer Island at half past five in the evening[.]
Wind Bound[.] Finding I was short of provisions I took 4 Toroes[.]
